{{primarysources|date=April 2007}} {{Infobox Software | name = CDRWIN | logo = [[Image:CDRWIN logo.png|40px]] | screenshot = [[Image:CDRWIN screenshot.png|250px]] | caption = CDRWIN 4.0G | developer = Golden Hawk Technology [http://www.goldenhawk.com/] | released = | latest_release_version = 4.0H | latest_release_date = {{release date and age|2010|5|28}} | latest_test_version = | programming language = | operating system = [[Microsoft Windows|Windows 95, 98, Me, 2000, XP, Vista]] | language = | status = current | genre = | license = [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]], [[Shareware]] | website = [http://www.goldenhawk.com/cdrwin.htm CDRWIN at goldenhawk.com] }} '''CDRWIN''' is a [[Optical disc authoring software|CD/DVD burning software]] for [[Microsoft Windows]] developed by Golden Hawk Technology company.
Once popular, CDRWIN's usage has diminished due to the bundling of limited versions of other software packages, such as [[Nero Burning ROM]] and [[Easy Media Creator|Roxio Easy CD Creator]], with new computers and optical drives.
==Unique features== CDRWIN is known for its unique features such as analyzing the [[Optical disc authoring#TOC|TOC]] of a CD. It is also one of the programs which introduced the [[Cue sheet (computing)|cue sheet]] format<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://wiki.hydrogenaudio.org/index.php?title=Cue_sheet|title=Cue sheet|work=Hydrogen audio knowledgebase|accessdate=2011-02-01}}</ref>.
CDRWIN is useful for the [[karaoke]] industry, as it fully supports reading/writing karaoke CDs.
==PlayStation TOC Protection== CDRWIN was mostly used during the [[PlayStation]] era. People could backup PlayStation games quickly and easily, and soon discovered that its unique cuesheet operations allowed them to alter the TOC for any CD being duplicated, provided the CD-Writer supported writing an invalid TOC. Most CD-Writing software could not make copies or images of the CD if the [[Optical disc authoring#TOC|TOC]] was invalid. This problem was overcome when [[CloneCD]] was released and duplication was made more accessible when [[Nero Burning ROM]] was updated to support this type of copying.
